intro: Andira vermifuga, commonly known as the wormwood andira, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its fruit is a small, dry capsule containing several seeds. Andira vermifuga is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
